intro: Haplopappus hookerianus, commonly known as Hooker's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense heads, and the leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Haplopappus hookerianus is known for its resilience and is often found in high-altitude regions.
